qas.question: What 1990s comic line featured futuristic, sci-fi stories?

In what year did Marvel introduce trading cards based on their characters?

answers.text: overall continuity of the fictional Marvel Universe

qas.question: What series was set in the past?

What marvel character was featured on the first collectible trading card?
When did comic book sales begin to decline?

context: Marvel earned a great deal of money and recognition during the comic book boom of <b9_0>the early 1990s<b9_0/>, launching the successful <a0_0><b5_0>2099<b5_0/> line<a0_0/> of comics set in the future (<b8_0>Spider-Man<b8_0/> 2099, etc.) and the creatively daring though commercially unsuccessful <a1_0><b6_0>Razorline<b6_0/><a1_0/> imprint of superhero comics created by novelist and filmmaker Clive Barker. In <a2_0><b7_0>1990<b7_0/><a2_0/>, Marvel began selling Marvel Universe Cards with trading card maker <a3_0>SkyBox International<a3_0/>. These were collectible trading cards that featured the characters and events of the Marvel Universe. The 1990s saw the rise of variant covers, cover enhancements, swimsuit issues, and company-wide crossovers that affected the <a4_0>overall continuity of the fictional Marvel Universe
